"Microgreens Farming": Microgreens are nutrient-dense versions of vegetables and can be grown indoors, allowing for year-round access to essential vitamins and minerals. They are also relatively easy to grow and can be harvested in as little as 1-3 weeks.

"Soy-Based Foods": Soy is a good source of protein and can be used to create a variety of foods that mimic the nutritional profile of fruits and vegetables. Soy can be used to make tofu, soy milk, and soy-based meat alternatives, all of which can be fortified with essential vitamins and minerals.

"Edible Flowers": Edible flowers can be used as a source of vitamins and minerals, and they can be grown in a home garden or purchased from local farmers. Edible flowers can be used in salads, smoothies, or as a garnish to add color and nutrition to meals.

"Bone Broths": Bone broths are rich in collagen, which is a key component of connective tissue and can be used to support the immune system and promote healthy skin, hair, and nails. They can be made by simmering animal bones with vegetables and herbs for an extended period.

"Probiotic-Rich Foods": Probiotics are beneficial bacteria that support gut health and can be found in fermented foods like sauerkraut, kimchi, and kefir. These foods can be made at home or purchased from health food stores and can be used to support the immune system and promote overall health.
